review.description:
so i'm originally from Cali.  i didn't know pizza until i ate at Grimaldi's.  pizza that doesn't make you feel like you've gained over 10 pounds after eating 2 slices?  simply unheard of.  

let me tell you.  this is Grimaldi's.  thin, lighly toasted crust that doesn't make you feel full after eating half the pizza.  i get red peppers and fresh basil, sprinkled with capers.  Mmmm...soooo deliciously delicious.

i've actually never had to wait long.  perhaps i got lucky.  the man ushering you in (older with white hair...appears initially kinda gruff, but actually is quite entertaining and funny) is freakin' hilarious if you get a chance to chat with him.  :)
review.author: Meilia Y.

review.description: Out of all the pizza places I've tried so far, I think this place is so far the best thin crust stuff you can find.  The pizza set-up is simple with fresh ingredients.  There is a small line outside the restaurant but the cycle moves fast.  The service, however, is a bit slow and then a bit hectic at the end when they want you to pay and leave.
review.author: Jennifer L.

review.description: Good pizza and reasonbly priced.  Much better than Lombardi's.  If you are visiting NY this place is a must try.  You can enjoy a good pizza (close to the Metro station) and go over and take a look at the Brooklyn bridge right after.  This place is located right under the bridge.
review.author: Jimmy K.

review.description: definitely worth the wait and was all that i heard it was. the key is to call them and have the pizza made for take out. you still have to wait in line but then when you get to the front you can take your pizza and eat it on the brooklyn bridge. thats what we did, and we saved ourselves about 30 minutes or so. And we got to eat on the brooklyn bridge at a bench which was nice.
review.author: Eric L.

review.description: Best pizza eva!!!!!! Thin, crunchy, and slightly charcoal crust YUMMEEEEEE
review.author: Gordon f.

review.description: I agree with some of the posts here. Unbelievably long line, even on a weekday night. Once in, we sat in the middle of a table with six other people, but we didn't care because we were just so happy to finally be in. The service wasn't bad, they asked for our drink orders right away and our pizza came REALLY fast. I figure they just want to get us in and out as quick as possible. Okay, so we ordered a sausage and onion pie and it wasn't bad....I mean it's good pizza.....just not the best or the greatest I've ever had...I really wanted to bite into it and say "HOLY CR*P, this is the most amazing mix of flavors I've ever experienced!!"...But instead I said "Eh.....it's good...." Definitely not worth the long wait and probably I won't be going back because...I hate waiting......It was funny though, while waiting on line outside, a tour bus would pass every ten minutes and the tourists would all wave to us. A majority of the customers were tourists and once inside, they would all whip out their cameras and take pictures of themselves eating the pizza.....I just thought it was hilarious.....I guess it's a bit of a tourist trap.....
review.author: Kathy P.

review.description: you know, new yorkers are picky about their pizza. picky AND subjective. i have heard many claim they know where to find the best nyc pizza. us californians don't know much about pizza, but in my not-so-humble opinion, grimaldi's in DUMBO is the best pizza in nyc. went during summer, waited over an hour in pouring rain, and it was still worth it. the ingredients make it worth it. fresh mozzarella, nice quality tomatoes, the mom & pop touch...bellissimo!
review.author: Jess V.

review.description: We ordered a small pizza with ricotta cheese, basil leaves and sweet roasted peppers. I don't know if it's because of the ricotta cheese but the center of the pie was really soggy. All the cheese and toppings just slid off the pizza when we lifted it off the pan. They're also pretty skimpy with the toppings. There definitely was not enough toppings for the extra $8 we paid for them. It was good but definitely not worth what it cost. I've had better for less.
review.author: Yoon J.

review.description: this is legitimate new york pizza. the aromas.. the flavors.. the textures. that's what i look for in all food... and grimaldis delivered (metaphorically.. i dunno if they actually deliver). all i know is that i went to new york expecting a pizza that would meet the high standards so i could talk about it.. and here i am. so there you go
review.author: geoffrey l.

review.description: this place is as good as people say! the pizza was so light and packed with flavor. shared a small pizza with pepperoni and mushrooms. we finished the whole thing and didn't even feel bad about it. the wait seems like it can get ridiculous though. we walked by around 11:15am and no one was there yet so we decided to walk down towards the little dock area. we went back at 11:25am and there were 20 people in line already! i was shocked at how many people were there at 11:30am. everyone got a table, but by the time we left around 12:30pm, there was already a wait outside. service was quick and seating is nice and cozy next to people that you don't know. this place definitely has a nice charm to it.
review.author: Linda N.

review.description: Good pizza.  Not amazing.  Line goes fast when you are in groups of two.
review.author: Scott C.

review.description:
walk over the brooklyn bridge
and have a pie with mushrooms, pepperoni and sausage.
it's old school family run
and well worth the walk.

just beware of the wait
review.author: Tracy T.

review.description: yes, it's worth it.  you'll feel like a tourist standing on the line surrounded with tourists, you'll have to wait half an hour once seated for the pizza, you won't expect to eat the whole thing in one sitting, and then its perfection will be too perfect to resist and you will and you'll love it.
review.author: Kiki B.

review.description: when i miss new york, i miss the pizza.  grimaldi's is definitely a place i miss going with friends from out of town.  the wait is long, but the pizza is phenemonal!  thin crust.  good sauce.  juicy sausage.  sigh.  i'm going back back to brooklyn brooklyn...
review.author: Dom C.

review.description:
one hour wait. i don't think any food is worth standing in line for one hour. 
pizza was good, but nothing was really outstanding.
it may be that this is some really authentic something-or-other style pizza, but, authentic or not, there are other pizzas that are at least as good as this that come without such a ridiculous wait.
review.author: Kan L.

review.description: I usually don't write reviews, but had to for this place.  I used to live in Chicago and swore I wouldn't like NY pizza no matter what.  I kept that view until I visited this place.  It was fantastic!  Everything from the sauce, fresh mozzerella, basil and crispy crust were great.  The only downside was the cramped seating at the Brooklyn Bridge location, but the pizza was so good it didn't bring down my rating.  Service was also friendly and fast.  If visiting NY, I highly recommend taking an afternoon to walk across the bridge, eat at Grimbaldi's on the Brooklyn side, then walk down to the river to enjoy a great view of the Statue of Liberty and Manhattan skyline.
review.author: Brian C.

review.description: The pizza was pretty good but not sure if I would walk over the Brooklyn Bridge, stand in line for 30-40 minutes in the bright sun and get a dropping of bird poop on me for it again.  Nevertheless, glad we took the time to check Grimaldi's out after reading about it so much.  It's a good "day trip" for Manhattanites that are stuck in the city for the weekend.
review.author: Jeanine L.

review.description: i love love their pizza.   it makes me want to come back to new york.  although its a little trek to brooklyn, its worth the wait.  if you go during the non peak hours, you won't have to wait very long at all.  i can eat a whole pizza with just two other friends... that's how good it is.  we got our pie with mushrooms, sundried tomato, sausage, and garlic. :) mmm.
review.author: Carli F.

review.description:
not enough that its rated the #1 pizza by both zagat and citysearch?

my friend (new yorker) brought me hear and wow, i hadn't thought much of NY pizza up to this point, and this place brought me to my knees.  A must visit for all out of towners as well as NY pizza lovers.  The amount of cheese is perfect, eat it while its hot as it congeals quickly.  The tomato sauce was amazing and the crust cooked to perfection.  The owner personal welcomes every customer at the door.

A short block or two from this place you can get really nice views of the city.
review.author: Alex C.

review.description: I had heard Grimaldi's was a yummy, must-dine spot when in Brooklyn, so my husband and I decided to give it a try during a recent trip to New York. We waited approximately 30 minutes to be seated, which wasn't horrible; I actually walked to a nearby dock to get some pictures of the Brooklyn Bridge and the New York skyline while my husband held our spots. Since we were a group of two, we were able to get a table before some of the larger groups that were ahead of us in line. We split a large pepperoni pizza. Unfortunately, our server got our order wrong and initially brought us just a plain pizza. He was super annoyed when we said we had requested pepperoni and tried to blame us for the mistake. Perhaps we weren't attentive enough when he read our order back to us, but as the waiter, he also should have been attentive when we placed it. I didn't see a need for him to be so rude when it was a simple correction: take it back to the kitchen and add some pepperoni. I assume working at such a popular, hectic spot can be stressful, so I didn't take his rudeness to heart. Eventually we received our pepperoni pizza. It was good, but it wasn't the life-changing meal I had heard it would be. The couple seated to the rights of us were in pizza nirvana; I thought they were about to orgasm with all the ooh-ing, aww-ing and salivating they were doing. The couple seated to the left of us seemed less than impressed with their pizza though, leaving a lot of it behind. Overall, Grimaldi's didn't live up to the hype, but the pizza was good enought to make it a worthwhile stop if you don't mind a wait.
review.author: Bonnie V.
